page.title: 08Whitwell Hall
page.content: Whitwell Hall was built in 1750 but in 1840 it was enlarged.The Hall has a flat inside.It is also used as a conference centre.There are camps for children in the summer.During term time schools go for a week.They do canoeing and other exciting things. In the winter they have pottery classes. Going through the grounds is a river. On the river there was a tannary.When the leather was ready it was sent from Whitwell station into Norwich to be made into shoes.There are a lot of lime and gravel pits which are now used as farm dumps.Grazing land has been converted into a tree plantation. They have an old ice house in the grounds which was used for keeping food fresh.There have been excavations of the old Whitwell village in the grounds.
